alert.note: Alert for Cuyahoga; Lorain (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 23 at 11:29PM EDT until August 24 at 2:30AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 AM EDT THURSDAY FOR NORTHERN LORAIN AND WEST CENTRAL CUYAHOGA COUNTIES... At 1129 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported considerable flooding across western Cuyahoga into Lorain County. Thunderstorms have produced heavy rain with amounts of 2.5 and 4.5 inches, especially from Lakewood to Lorain. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Interstate 90 is closed in multiple locations. Water rescues have been reported. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cleveland, Lorain, Elyria, Vermilion, Parma, Lakewood, Westlake, North Ridgeville, Avon Lake, Amherst, North Olmsted, Garfield Heights, Avon, Rocky River, Brook Park, Fairview Park, Bay Village, Brooklyn, Sheffield Lake and Independence. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
